intro: Epirixanthes papuana f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered piper, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes various species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly pubescent surface. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral characteristics, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
